intro: Ulex nanus var. major, commonly known as the greater sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Platanaceae. It is a shrub-like species native to coastal areas of the British Isles and parts of northern Europe. The plant is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant is adapted to saline and windy environments, making it a hardy species found in coastal habitats.
